page.title: 12Flora of Torridon
page.content: The flora of the place is of a great variety.Spring flowers grow well,most common are violets,gorse or whin,wood sorrel,tormentil,milk & butter wort, lousewort;ling & bell heather,primrose rhododendron or ponticum,flag iris, clover,bramble & vetch.Also found are orchid species,marsh marigold,dog rose speedwell,bog myrtle bog asphodel,herb robert,sea pink & white,foxglove,wild hyacinth,celandine.There are various grasses,rushes,mosses & bog cotton covering a lot of the land. The soil is quite shallow,stoney and acid,so plants, flowers & trees growing close to the ground or having lateral roots & liking peaty soil do well.Sheep and deer damage and destroy plants,strip the bark off trees,graze & trample the plants.Winds also cause damage.Conifer birch,rowan,elder,sycamore are common; alder,aspen & willow in boggy land.
